perturbation.original_text:
(g) Governing Law; Choice of Venue.

(i) This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of Delaware applicable to agreements made and to be performed within that state, without giving effect to any law or principals of law that would result in the application of the laws of any other jurisdiction.

(ii) Each Party (A) consents to submit itself to the personal jurisdiction of the Court of Chancery or other federal or state courts of the State of Delaware in the event any dispute arises out of this Agreement or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, (B) agrees that it shall not attempt to deny or defeat such personal jurisdiction by motion or other request for leave from any such court, (C) agrees that it shall not bring any action relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement in any court other than the Court of Chancery or other federal or state courts of the State of Delaware, and each Party irrevocably waives the right to trial by jury and (D) irrevocably consents to service of process by a reputable overnight mail delivery service, signature requested, to the address of such Party's principal place of business or as otherwise provided by applicable law.
perturbation.changed_text:
(g) Governing Law; Choice of Venue.

(i) This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state where Marathon Partners Equity Management, LLC is located.

(ii) Each Party (A) consents to submit itself to the personal jurisdiction of the court where its principal place of business is located, (B) agrees that it may attempt to deny or defeat such personal jurisdiction by motion or other request for leave from any such court, (C) agrees that it may bring any action relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement in any court other than the court where its principal place of business is located, and each Party may revoke their consent to service of process
perturbation.explanation: The governing law and choice of venue clauses were modified to introduce ambiguity and potential conflict. By stating the agreement is governed by the laws of the state where Marathon Partners is located, it creates a conflict, as the agreement previously and more explicitly states that Delaware law governs. Further, the other stipulations are subject to change at either party's discretion.

perturbation.original_text: (h) Reimbursement. The Company shall reimburse the Marathon Parties for their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses, including the reasonable fees and expenses of counsel, incurred in connection with their engagement with the Company, the Nominations and the negotiation of, and all matters arising under this Agreement; provided, however, that such reimbursement shall not exceed $250,000.
perturbation.changed_text: (h) Reimbursement. The Company may, at its sole discretion, reimburse the Marathon Parties for a portion of their expenses, excluding legal fees, up to a maximum of $250,000, subject to the approval of the CEO.
perturbation.explanation: The modification replaces 'shall' with 'may, at its sole discretion,' introducing uncertainty about whether reimbursement will occur. Excluding legal fees and adding CEO approval creates further hurdles, contradicting the original intent of guaranteed reimbursement and making it difficult to enforce.

perturbation.original_text: (a) Specific Enforcement; Special Remedy. Each of the Parties agrees that the other Party would be irreparably injured in the event that any provision of the Agreement is breached or not performed. Accordingly, it is agreed that each Party shall be entitled to temporary and permanent injunctive relief with respect to each and any breach or purported repudiation of this Agreement by the other and to specifically enforce strict adherence to this Agreement and the terms and provisions hereof against the other in any action instituted in a court of competent jurisdiction, in addition to any other remedy which such aggrieved Party may be entitled to obtain. Moreover, in the event of the breach of any of the provisions of this Agreement, timeliness in obtaining relief is of the essence.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) Specific Enforcement; Special Remedy. While both Parties acknowledge that a breach of this Agreement may cause injury, the availability of injunctive relief is subject to the discretion of the court and the applicable laws at the time of the breach. Neither party is guaranteed specific performance, and other remedies may be considered.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that both parties are entitled to injunctive relief if this agreement is breached. The change inserts uncertainty by stating that injunctive relief is 'subject to the discretion of the court,' contradicting the original intention of guaranteed injunctive relief.
